Package infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete, SeparableInfoCalculatorDiscrete, SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator, TransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete
    public abstract class ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
    A base class for calculators computing measures which require knowledge of the embedded past state of a univariate discrete (ie int[]) variable. Usage is as per InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete, but with some extra utility functions provided for computing embedding vectors.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

        public ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete()
        Construct an instance with default base 2 and history 1 and not keeping sample counts

      • ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

        public ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete​(int base,
                                              int history)
        Construct an instance
        Parameters:
        base - number of quantisation levels for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        history - embedding length

      • ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

        protected ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete​(int base,
                                                 int history,
                                                 boolean dontCreateObsStorage)
        Constructor to be used by child classes only. In general, only needs to be explicitly called if child classes do not wish to create the observation arrays.
        Parameters:
        base - number of quantisation levels for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        history - embedding length
        dontCreateObsStorage - do not create storage for observations of the embedded past (as the child class is signalling that it does not need it)

      • computePastValue

        public int computePastValue​(int[] x,
                            int t)
        Utility function to compute the combined embedded past values of x up to and including time step t (i.e. (x_{t-k+1}, ... ,x_{t-1},x_{t}))
        Parameters:
        x - time-series data
        t - compute embedding vector up to and including index t
        Returns:
        int value representing the embedding vector translated into a unique integer

      • computePastValue

        public int computePastValue​(int[][] data,
                            int columnNumber,
                            int t)
        Utility function to compute the combined embedded past values of x up to and including time step t (i.e. (x_{t-k+1}, ... ,x_{t-1},x_{t})) where x is a column in data
        Parameters:
        data - multivariate time-series data (first index is time, second is variable number)
        columnNumber - which column to embed
        t - compute embedding vector up to and including index t
        Returns:
        int value representing the embedding vector translated into a unique integer

      • computePastValue

        public int computePastValue​(int[][][] data,
                            int rowNumber,
                            int columnNumber,
                            int t)
        Utility function to compute the combined embedded past values of x up to and including time step t (i.e. (x_{t-k+1}, ... ,x_{t-1},x_{t})) where x is a time-series for a given row and column in data
        Parameters:
        data - multivariate time-series data (first index is time, second is row number for the variable and third is column number for the variable)
        rowNumber - row number of the variable to embed
        columnNumber - column number of the variable to embed
        t - compute embedding vector up to and including index t
        Returns:
        int value representing the embedding vector translated into a unique integer
